metadata.feature_description: Manage article metadata, custom fields, and article type categorization

steps.action: Navigate to Wiki module and click Create article
steps.expected: Create article dialog opens with Article Type dropdown
steps.actual: Create article dialog opened with Article Type dropdown enabled

steps.action: Fill in title, select Events as Article Type, add content and tags
steps.expected: Form fields accept input and Article Type can be selected
steps.actual: Title set to 'Metadata Test Article - Jan 2026', Article Type set to 'Events', content and tag added successfully

steps.action: Click Publish to create the article
steps.expected: Article is created with selected article type
steps.actual: Article published successfully and page navigated to new article view

steps.action: Click Edit... in Overview section to open metadata editor
steps.expected: Edit Meta Data dialog opens with Image and Metadata tabs
steps.actual: Edit Meta Data dialog opened with two tabs: Image and Metadata

steps.action: Click Metadata tab to view article-type-specific fields
steps.expected: Metadata fields specific to Events article type are displayed
steps.actual: Fields displayed: Name, Location, Date, Participants, # of Participants, Outcome, Website

steps.action: Fill in metadata fields with test values
steps.actual: Successfully entered: Name='Annual Tech Conference 2026', Location='New York City, NY', Date='March 15, 2026', Participants='Developers, Architects, Tech Leaders', # of Participants='500', Website='https://techconference2026.example.com'

steps.expected: Metadata is saved and displayed in Overview section
steps.actual: Metadata saved successfully and displayed in Overview table on article page

steps.action: Click Edit... to open metadata editor again
steps.expected: Dialog opens with previously saved values
steps.actual: Dialog opened showing all previously saved metadata values

steps.action: Change Location field from 'New York City, NY' to 'San Francisco, CA'
steps.actual: Location field successfully updated to 'San Francisco, CA'

steps.action: Click Save to save edited metadata
steps.expected: Updated value is saved and displayed
steps.actual: Location now shows 'San Francisco, CA' in Overview section

steps.action: Open metadata editor and clear the '# of Participants' field

steps.expected: Cleared field is removed from display
steps.actual: '# of Participants' row no longer appears in Overview section

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test metadata display in article view

steps.action: View article page after saving metadata
steps.expected: Metadata is displayed in Overview section on right sidebar
steps.actual: Overview section displays metadata in a table format with field names and values

steps.action: Verify Website field displays as clickable link
steps.expected: URL metadata fields are rendered as hyperlinks
steps.actual: Website field 'https://techconference2026.example.com' displayed as clickable link

steps.action: Verify metadata fields accept various input types
steps.expected: Fields accept text, numbers, dates, and URLs
steps.actual: All field types (text, date picker, numeric, URL) functioned correctly. Date field showed date picker widget.

observations: Article Type dropdown is disabled for existing articles - type can only be set during article creation
Metadata fields are dynamically generated based on the selected Article Type
Events article type includes fields: Name, Location, Date, Participants, # of Participants, Outcome, Website
Date field includes a date picker widget for easy date selection
Website/URL fields are automatically rendered as clickable hyperlinks in the display view
Clearing a metadata field value effectively removes it from the display (delete functionality)
Metadata is displayed in the 'Overview' section on the right sidebar of the article view
Code suggests support for multiple field types: Date (0), Text (1), URL (2), Boolean (3), Multiline text (4)
